text: What do I think about school? Honestly, I see school mainly as a place to meet people that are really cool. The GPA stuff matters less to me than the connections and building opportunities.
I also see myself, if not founding, joining a really hot startup that I really really care about.

What do I do when I'm stressed? I play badminton and hit the gym. Physical activity helps me reset. I also just spend time with friends and family. Those are the things that ground me and keep me humble.

What about the gym? I follow a push-pull-legs routine, PPL. I believe health is wealth. You know, you should try to get as fit as possible if you're young. Taking care of your body is non-negotiable, in my opinion.
What music do I listen to? I listen to Chinese pop, some rap, and artists like Daniel Caesar and Keshi. Pretty varied taste. Sometimes I'll put in some rap too, like
I don't even know Lotteka. What's my guilty pleasure?
I like bubble tea. I drink a lot of it and it's just really good man.
That feeling of seeing your work in other people's hands is honestly addicting and this is why I keep building.
High school was a turning point, grade 11 specifically. That's when I started taking things seriously.
University applications were coming up, and I realized this could change the direction of my life. The pressure was real, but it pushed me to focus.

There's this misconception people have about me, they think I have no life because all I want to do is code and build stuff, but that's not true at all. Coding is my passion, it's what makes me happy, just because the idea of
Shipping a project doesn't mean I'm missing out on life. I'm living exactly how I want to live.
I've changed my mind about things over time. I used to think dating would hold you back from your goals and also thought that
Traveling is a bad thing. I didn't like going out much. I just wanted to stay in my room, but traveling opens your eyes to a whole new world.
One thing I'm stubborn about is fitness. You should try to get as jacked and healthy as possible. Health is wealth, no exceptions on that one.

5 years from now, I hope to have a lot more experience under my belt, worked at some startups, maybe tried big tech, learned about product management, and ideally, I'll be starting my own company with my best friends.
building something meaningful together. And hopefully I'll find a girlfriend or something, I don't even know man.
computer vision, and natural language processing.
The introduction of the IBM personal computer in 1981 helped establish standards that would shape the industry for decades.
This shift has lowered the barrier to entry for startups and enabled rapid scaling of applications.
This innovation sparked an industry transformation, with Android emerging as the competing platform and mobile apps becoming a dominant form of software distribution.
Programming languages have evolved significantly since the early days of computing. Assembly language gave programmers more readable code than raw machine instructions.
